verses.text: Thou shalt not \w see|strong="H7200"\w* thy \w brother’s|strong="H0251"\w* \w ox|strong="H7794"\w* or his \w sheep|strong="H7716"\w* go \w astray|strong="H5080"\w*, and \w hide|strong="H5956"\w* thyself from them: thou shalt in any \w case|strong="H7725"\w* bring them \w again|strong="H7725"\w* unto thy \w brother|strong="H0251"\w*.

And if thy \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* \add be\add* not \w nigh|strong="H7138"\w* unto thee, or if thou \w know|strong="H3045"\w* him not, then thou shalt \w bring|strong="H0622"\w* it \w unto|strong="H8432"\w* thine own \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and it shall be with thee until thy \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* \w seek|strong="H1875"\w* after it, and thou shalt restore it to him \w again|strong="H7725"\w*.

In like \w manner|strong="H3651"\w* shalt thou \w do|strong="H6213"\w* with his \w ass|strong="H2543"\w*; and so shalt thou \w do|strong="H6213"\w* with his \w raiment|strong="H8071"\w*; and with all lost \w thing|strong="H0009"\w* of thy \w brother’s|strong="H0251"\w*, which he hath \w lost|strong="H0006"\w*, and thou hast \w found|strong="H4672"\w*, shalt thou \w do|strong="H6213"\w* likewise: thou \w mayest|strong="H3201"\w* not \w hide|strong="H5956"\w* thyself.

¶ Thou shalt not \w see|strong="H7200"\w* thy \w brother’s|strong="H0251"\w* \w ass|strong="H2543"\w* or his \w ox|strong="H7794"\w* fall \w down|strong="H5307"\w* by the \w way|strong="H1870"\w*, and \w hide|strong="H5956"\w* thyself from them: thou shalt \w surely|strong="H6965"\w* help him to lift \add them\add* up \w again|strong="H6965"\w*.

¶ The \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* shall not wear that which \w pertaineth|strong="H3627"\w* unto a \w man|strong="H1397"\w*, neither shall a \w man|strong="H1397"\w* \w put|strong="H3847"\w* on a \w woman’s|strong="H0802"\w* \w garment|strong="H8071"\w*: for all that \w do|strong="H6213"\w* \w so|strong="H0428"\w* \add are\add* \w abomination|strong="H8441"\w* unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w*.

¶ If a \w bird’s|strong="H6833"\w* \w nest|strong="H7064"\w* \w chance|strong="H7122"\w* to be \w before|strong="H6440"\w* thee in the \w way|strong="H1870"\w* in any \w tree|strong="H6086"\w*, or on the \w ground|strong="H0776"\w*, \add whether they be\add* young \w ones|strong="H0667"\w*, or \w eggs|strong="H1000"\w*, and the \w dam|strong="H0517"\w* \w sitting|strong="H7257"\w* upon the \w young|strong="H0667"\w*, or upon the \w eggs|strong="H1000"\w*, thou shalt not \w take|strong="H3947"\w* the \w dam|strong="H0517"\w* with the \w young|strong="H1121"\w*:

\add But\add* thou shalt in any \w wise|strong="H7971"\w* let the \w dam|strong="H0517"\w* \w go|strong="H7971"\w*, and \w take|strong="H3947"\w* the \w young|strong="H1121"\w* to thee; that it may be \w well|strong="H3190"\w* with thee, and \add that\add* thou mayest \w prolong|strong="H0748"\w* \add thy\add* \w days|strong="H3117"\w*.

¶ When thou \w buildest|strong="H1129"\w* a \w new|strong="H2319"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, then thou shalt \w make|strong="H6213"\w* a \w battlement|strong="H4624"\w* for thy \w roof|strong="H1406"\w*, that thou \w bring|strong="H7760"\w* not \w blood|strong="H1818"\w* upon thine \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, if any \w man|strong="H5307"\w* \w fall|strong="H5307"\w* from thence.

¶ Thou shalt not \w sow|strong="H2232"\w* thy \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w* with divers \w seeds|strong="H3610"\w*: lest the \w fruit|strong="H4395"\w* of thy \w seed|strong="H2233"\w* which thou hast \w sown|strong="H2232"\w*, and the \w fruit|strong="H8393"\w* of thy \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w*, be \w defiled|strong="H6942"\w*.\f + \fr 22.9 \ft fruit of thy seed: Heb. fulness of the seed\f*
¶ Thou shalt not \w plow|strong="H2790"\w* with an \w ox|strong="H7794"\w* and an \w ass|strong="H2543"\w* \w together|strong="H3162"\w*.
¶ Thou shalt not \w wear|strong="H3847"\w* a garment of divers \w sorts|strong="H8162"\w*, \add as\add* of \w woollen|strong="H6785"\w* and \w linen|strong="H6593"\w* \w together|strong="H3162"\w*.

¶ Thou shalt \w make|strong="H6213"\w* thee \w fringes|strong="H1434"\w* upon the \w four|strong="H0702"\w* \w quarters|strong="H3671"\w* of thy \w vesture|strong="H3682"\w*, wherewith thou \w coverest|strong="H3680"\w* \add thyself\add*.\f + \fr 22.12 \ft quarters: Heb. wings\f*
¶ If any \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w take|strong="H3947"\w* a \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*, and go \w in|strong="H0935"\w* unto her, and \w hate|strong="H8130"\w* her,

And \w give|strong="H7760"\w* \w occasions|strong="H5949"\w* of \w speech|strong="H1697"\w* against her, and bring \w up|strong="H3318"\w* an \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w name|strong="H8034"\w* upon her, and \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, I \w took|strong="H3947"\w* this \w woman|strong="H0802"\w*, and when I \w came|strong="H7126"\w* to her, I \w found|strong="H4672"\w* her not a \w maid|strong="H1331"\w*:

Then shall the \w father|strong="H0001"\w* of the \w damsel|strong="H5291"\w*, and her \w mother|strong="H0517"\w*, \w take|strong="H3947"\w* and bring \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* \add the tokens of\add* the \w damsel’s|strong="H5291"\w* \w virginity|strong="H1331"\w* unto the \w elders|strong="H2205"\w* of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* in the \w gate|strong="H8179"\w*:

And the \w damsel’s|strong="H5291"\w* \w father|strong="H0001"\w* shall \w say|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w elders|strong="H2205"\w*, I \w gave|strong="H5414"\w* my \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* unto this \w man|strong="H0376"\w* to \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*, and he \w hateth|strong="H8130"\w* her;

And, lo, he hath \w given|strong="H7760"\w* \w occasions|strong="H5949"\w* of \w speech|strong="H1697"\w* \add against her\add*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, I \w found|strong="H4672"\w* not thy \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* a \w maid|strong="H1331"\w*; and yet these \add are the tokens of\add* my \w daughter’s|strong="H1323"\w* \w virginity|strong="H1331"\w*. And they shall \w spread|strong="H6566"\w* the \w cloth|strong="H8071"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w elders|strong="H2205"\w* of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*.
And the \w elders|strong="H2205"\w* of that \w city|strong="H5892"\w* shall \w take|strong="H3947"\w* that \w man|strong="H0376"\w* and \w chastise|strong="H3256"\w* him;

And they shall \w amerce|strong="H6064"\w* him in an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \add shekels\add* of \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*, and \w give|strong="H5414"\w* \add them\add* unto the \w father|strong="H0001"\w* of the \w damsel|strong="H5291"\w*, because he hath brought \w up|strong="H3318"\w* an \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w name|strong="H8034"\w* upon a \w virgin|strong="H1330"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*: and she shall be his \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*; he \w may|strong="H3201"\w* not put her \w away|strong="H7971"\w* all his \w days|strong="H3117"\w*.
But if this \w thing|strong="H1697"\w* be \w true|strong="H0571"\w*, \add and the tokens of\add* \w virginity|strong="H1331"\w* be not \w found|strong="H4672"\w* for the \w damsel|strong="H5291"\w*:

Then they shall bring \w out|strong="H3318"\w* the \w damsel|strong="H5291"\w* to the \w door|strong="H6607"\w* of her \w father’s|strong="H0001"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of her \w city|strong="H5892"\w* shall \w stone|strong="H5619"\w* her with \w stones|strong="H0068"\w* that she \w die|strong="H4191"\w*: because she hath \w wrought|strong="H6213"\w* \w folly|strong="H5039"\w* in \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, to play the \w whore|strong="H2181"\w* in her \w father’s|strong="H0001"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*: so shalt thou \w put|strong="H1197"\w* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w away|strong="H1197"\w* from \w among|strong="H7130"\w* you.

¶ If a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* be \w found|strong="H4672"\w* \w lying|strong="H7901"\w* with a \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* \w married|strong="H1166"\w* to an \w husband|strong="H1167"\w*, then they shall both of \w them|strong="H8147"\w* \w die|strong="H4191"\w*, \add both\add* the \w man|strong="H0376"\w* that \w lay|strong="H7901"\w* with the \w woman|strong="H0802"\w*, and the \w woman|strong="H0802"\w*: so shalt thou put \w away|strong="H1197"\w* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* from \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.

¶ If a \w damsel|strong="H5291"\w* \add that is\add* a \w virgin|strong="H1330"\w* be \w betrothed|strong="H0781"\w* unto an \w husband|strong="H0376"\w*, and a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w find|strong="H4672"\w* her in the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and \w lie|strong="H7901"\w* with her;

Then ye shall \w bring|strong="H3318"\w* them \w both|strong="H8147"\w* out unto the \w gate|strong="H8179"\w* of that \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and ye shall \w stone|strong="H5619"\w* them with \w stones|strong="H0068"\w* that they \w die|strong="H4191"\w*; the \w damsel|strong="H5291"\w*, \w because|strong="H0834"\w* she \w cried|strong="H6817"\w* not, \add being\add* in the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*; and the \w man|strong="H0376"\w*, \w because|strong="H0834"\w* he hath \w humbled|strong="H6031"\w* his \w neighbour’s|strong="H7453"\w* \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*: so thou shalt put \w away|strong="H1197"\w* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* from \w among|strong="H7130"\w* you.

¶ But if a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w find|strong="H4672"\w* a \w betrothed|strong="H0781"\w* \w damsel|strong="H5291"\w* in the \w field|strong="H7704"\w*, and the \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w force|strong="H2388"\w* her, and \w lie|strong="H7901"\w* with her: then the \w man|strong="H0376"\w* only that \w lay|strong="H7901"\w* with her shall \w die|strong="H4191"\w*:\f + \fr 22.25 \ft force: or, take strong hold of\f*

But unto the \w damsel|strong="H5291"\w* thou shalt \w do|strong="H6213"\w* \w nothing|strong="H1697"\w*; \add there is\add* in the \w damsel|strong="H5291"\w* no \w sin|strong="H2399"\w* \add worthy\add* of \w death|strong="H4194"\w*: for as when a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w riseth|strong="H6965"\w* against his \w neighbour|strong="H7453"\w*, and \w slayeth|strong="H7523"\w* him, even so \add is\add* this \w matter|strong="H1697"\w*:

For he \w found|strong="H4672"\w* her in the \w field|strong="H7704"\w*, \add and\add* the \w betrothed|strong="H0781"\w* \w damsel|strong="H5291"\w* \w cried|strong="H6817"\w*, and \add there was\add* none to \w save|strong="H3467"\w* her.

¶ If a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w find|strong="H4672"\w* a \w damsel|strong="H5291"\w* \add that is\add* a \w virgin|strong="H1330"\w*, which is not \w betrothed|strong="H0781"\w*, and lay \w hold|strong="H8610"\w* on her, and \w lie|strong="H7901"\w* with her, and they be \w found|strong="H4672"\w*;

Then the \w man|strong="H0376"\w* that \w lay|strong="H7901"\w* with her shall \w give|strong="H5414"\w* unto the \w damsel’s|strong="H5291"\w* \w father|strong="H0001"\w* \w fifty|strong="H2572"\w* \add shekels\add* of \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*, and she shall be his \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*; because he hath \w humbled|strong="H6031"\w* her, he \w may|strong="H3201"\w* not put her \w away|strong="H7971"\w* all his \w days|strong="H3117"\w*.

¶ A \w man|strong="H0376"\w* shall not \w take|strong="H3947"\w* his \w father’s|strong="H0001"\w* \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*, nor \w discover|strong="H1540"\w* his \w father’s|strong="H0001"\w* \w skirt|strong="H3671"\w*.
